Posts.Content: miamigirl000 wrote: Hi ladies, i just came back from preop (EB on Wed.). I was told that i would be also having the frozen section. Will this be done right in the operating room? Will they be able to go for "clear margins" if it is positive? Will i have results of the FS before i go home that day??? Thanks girls, shannon Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Frozen section question miamigirl000 cindiedee

Posts.Content: miamigirl000 wrote: Thank you so much to all of you who help me through all this mess! You are all a wonderful group of women! I got my results today: path report reads: L breast mass recieved in formalin and consists of a 3.0 x 1.5 x 1.0cmsegment of fibrofatty breast tissue. Diagnosis: Benign breast tissue w/ fibrocystic changes Anyone have any insight on this??? The surgeon just said it was no big deal and that was the extent of my visit (he has been very nonschlant during this entire thing). I did mention that i found a pea sized lump just above the inscision last night and the sight is getting increasingly red, so he said maybe i had some fluid and prescribed antibiotics. My ? is that the FNB showed A-tip cells, does this go along w/ the findings??? Well thank you for everything ladies, i wish you all luck in your journys! Love and health! shannon Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: EB results! B9!!!! miamigirl000 lvtwoqlt

Posts.Content: miamigirl000 wrote: Hi ladies, i finally got my excisional biop date! I am going in on the 19th (dec)!!!! The surgeon called and said that the lump was visible on MRI, after not being seen on mamo/us, and we should take it out based on the fam. history. The small scattered area of "stuff" i have he said we unfortunatly have to "watch and wait" I will repeat mri in a few months and go from there w/ that area. I am sooooo happy that i will have this out of the way before the holidays!!! Thanks again to all of you who have helped me through this difficult time over the last 6mo w/ both these stupid lumps i have had and will now finally be rid of!!!! Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: surgical date set! miamigirl000 MsSherry

Posts.Content: miamigirl000 wrote: Hello ladies. I met w/ the surgeon for the lump in my breast. The surgeon said that because of my very strong family history, that the lump should indeed come out. The problem is that because i am lactating, he can not do the lumpectomy because it puts me at risk for problems with my milk moving into the surgical hole and causing problems. So, we will be doing a biopsy on the 20th (needle) and then i will be working on drying up my milk and then in 6wks we will do the lumpectomy. My ? is, that if the lump is comming out regardless of the needle biop. results, do i really need to subject myself to the needle biop also??? this just adds to my stress, bills my insurance, and is another surgical procedure. The surgeon said that the lump will come out even if the biop is neg, so then whats the point? do u think that if it were pos for cancer that they would risk the lumpectomy while i was still lactating? If this is the case, then of course i would do it..... i know i need to call the doc and ask about this....just wanted your thoughts on it. He also mentioned that he thought the lump was one of 3 things.... a lypoma (sp) a fibroma (sp), not sure if this was correct word a cancer that grew fast due to my estrogen from pregnancy anyways, thanks again for all your help! shannon Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Met with surgeon, the decision, and more questions miamigirl000 Cynthia1962

Posts.Content: miamigirl000 wrote: Hi ladies, well, i am having my second excisional biop this wed., Dec. 19thÂ (first lump was fibrocystic). I was talking to my mom yesterday, and she told me that her first (of two) cancers was found on Dec. 19th (27yrs ago). She was also my same age at the time.....Im so ready to get this thing out and having results...the not knowing is what kills me the most, i can deal w/ anything that comes my way, but i just want to be dealing/or not dealing w/ it already! LOL....The surgeon i am using is the one that dx my mom's cancer 27yrs ago, and he told her before surgery that it was NOT cancer, that it was fibro disease, and got in and realized it was cancer....im just terrified that everything is going to go the same way for me...am i crazy???? Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Getting scared miamigirl000 MsSherry

Posts.Content: miamigirl000 wrote: Hello ladies, i had a solid mass (2 1/2 cm) removed 3-4mo ago. It was benign, showing fibrocystic disease. Have a large family history (mother had two dif. BC, aunt passed, gmas, and 1st cousin ALL prematapausal) I found another lump and just had a mamo/us. The report reads as this. "The breasts are heterogeneously dense which may lower the sensitivity of mammography. Benign appearing calcifications are present. Bilateral breast u/s obtained on the same day was unremarkable. Impression" No mammographic evidence of malignancy. Routine follow up reocmmended. NOTE: An xray report which is neg. for cancer should not delay biopsy if a dominant or clinically suspicious mass is present. Sone cancers are not identified by xray. Adenosis and fibrocystic disease may obscure an underlying neoplasm." WTF....is the "note" just to cover their ass? I meet the surgeon, a new one from last time (horrible experience w/ first surgeon), so i guess i will have more info then...any thoughts on this, the calcifications, ect??? There was no mention of the actual lump that is palpable (probally the size of maybe 2cm or so), but very obvious when felt. Thanks in advance!!! shannon Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Help w/ Mamo report miamigirl000 carlen

Posts.Content: miamigirl000 wrote: Hello everyone, i just had a baby and found a fairly large lump in my breast. U/S showed it to be a solid mass. With a family history of mother: 2x estrogen fed BC survivor at ages 30 & 35, her sister died at age 40 from BC, both grandmothers survived it, and my 1st cousin (age 40) was just dx.... My ob and my family all want me to have the lump taken out rather than having a needle asp. I would feel more comfortable taking it out to.... I meet w/ the surgeon tomarrow for the first time. I was wondering if anyone surgeon would just let them decide to have it completely removed rather than needle asp??? I am 34yr old and scared to death, with a 4yr old and a 7wk old baby... any thoughts greatly apprecieated. Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: 2.5cm solid mass, need ur thoughts miamigirl000 Shirlann
